thread.title: U.S. oil prices fall for second day after stockpiles

author: cnbc.com
title: U.S. oil prices fall for second day after stockpiles
text:
TOKYO, Feb 28 (Reuters) - U.S. oil prices extended declines into a second day after industry data showed an increase in U.S. crude and gasoline stockpiles, with surging production in the country hampering OPEC attempts to end a global glut.
  19 cents, or 0.3 percent, at $62.82 by 0028     yet to trade. On Tuesday, the contract fell 87 cents to close at $66.63 a barrel.
U.S. crude stockpiles climbed last week as imports increased, while gasoline inventories climbed and distillate stocks were drawn down, industry group   said on Tuesday.
Crude inventories   421.2 million, compared with analyst expectations for an increase of 2.1 million barrels.
Crude stocks at the Cushing, Oklahoma, delivery hub fell by 1.3 million barrels, the API said. Refinery   day, API data showed.
(Reporting by Aaron Sheldrick Editing by Joseph Radford)
